intro: Staebe ragusina, commonly known as the Ragusan staebe, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Staebe ragusina is often found in rocky or limestone-rich habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
